context.description: This dialog box displays the status of the projects that were published. For more detailed information, click Details. A scrollable box appears at the bottom of this dialog box.
This dialog box displays the status of the projects that were published. For more detailed information, click Details. A scrollable box appears at the bottom of this dialog box.
This dialog box displays the status of the projects that were published. For more detailed information, click Details. A scrollable box appears at the bottom of this dialog box.
This dialog box displays the status of the projects that were published. For more detailed information, click Details. A scrollable box appears at the bottom of this dialog box.
This change cannot be undone.
Informational message indicating that server is not responding and that you may want to terminate it by clicking OK.
Use to set the preferences that servers will use for testing projects.

Specifies that all the files should automatically be published to the local server at every seconds intervals, where seconds is the number of seconds you have specified in the control. The minimum value for the publishing interval is ten seconds.

Specifies that all the files should automatically be published to the remote server at every seconds intervals, where seconds is the number of seconds you have specified in the control. The minimum value for the publishing interval is ten seconds.
Specifies that all the files should automatically be published before starting the server.
Specifies that the server tools can automatically restart the server when it detects that the server must be restarted to handle resource changes in the workspace.
Specifies that the server tools will prompt you before you make a change in a editor that cannot be undone.
The Servers view is displayed on the workbench when there are any activities in the Servers view.

Specifies the preferences for saving the changes in any open server editors before starting the server. Select Never to never save the changes in any open editors before starting the server. Select Prompt to have the server tools prompt you before saving any changes in an open server editor. Select Auto-save to have the server tools automatically save any changes in an open server editor before starting the server.

Select the relative length of time you can wait before ending a server operation. The default setting is Normal. Tip: If you have a fast processing machine, you can try using the Shorter timeout delay option. If you have a slow processing machine, you can try using the Longer timeout delay option.

The Server view allows you to manage servers. This view displays a list of all your servers and the server configurations that are associated with each server. You can use this view to start, start in debug mode, restart, and stop servers.
Use to import a server configuration that is located outside of the workspace but is on the same machine.
The name assigned to the server configuration that you want to import.
The name of the server project that will contain the server configuration that you want to import. Select the name from the list of available server projects.
The type of server configuration that will be imported. Select a type from the list of available configuration types.
The location from which you want to import a server configuration. You may either type the fully qualified pathin the Location field if you know it, or click Browse to find it.
The location from which you want to import a server configuration. You may either type the fully qualified path in the Location field if you know it, or click Browse to find it.

This wizard creates a new server and a new server configuration. A server contains information required to point to a specific run-time environment for local or remote testing, or for deployment to an application server. A server configuration contains information required to set up and deploy to a server.

The type of environment that you want to use for this server. A list of available server types is shown. For more details on each of the supported server types, select a type from the list and read the description that appears in the Description area of this wizard page.
If a resource can run on several server clients, this dialog box will display them allowing you to select which one will be used.
If a resource can run on several server clients, this dialog box will display them allowing you to select which one will be used.
Select a server to launch.
Select an existing server.
List of existing servers that can be launched.
Create a new server to launch.
List of types of servers that can be launched.
A preferred server is the server that you want to use when a project has more than one server defined. Click to set the selected server as your preferred server.
To confirm that you want to launch the selected object, click Finish.
Specify the host name and other server settings.
Specify the name assign to the server. This name is displayed in the Servers view under the Server column.

Specifies the location where the server configuration files are stored on the workbench. For example, if you specified the Configuration path to be /Servers/Tomcat v4.1 Server @ localhost-config, the files are available in the Navigator view, expand the folders: Servers > Tomcat v4.1 Server @ localhost-config.
The fully qualified DNS name or IP address of the host machine where the server is running.

Specifies the name of the installed server runtime environment as defined in the Preferences page (Window > Preferences > Server > Installed Runtimes). The installed server runtime environment defines the runtime environment of an application server for compiling your application. To change the installed server runtime enviornment, select the Edit runtime link.
Specify to use the publishing settings as defined in the Preferences page (Windows > Preferences > Server).

Specifies that all the files should automatically be published to the server at every seconds interval, where seconds is the number of seconds you have specified in the Publishing interval control. The minimum value for the publishing interval is ten seconds.
Specifies the tools should never publish files to the server.
